arguments.name: type
arguments.description:
Type (severity) of the message:
- information (default)
- warning
- error
- fatal

arguments.name: application
arguments.description: log application name, if it is specified in a cfapplication tag.

arguments.name: file
arguments.description:
Message file. Specify only the main part of the filename. For example, to log to the Testing.log file, specify "Testing". The file must be located in the default log directory. You cannot specify a directory path. 
If the file does not exist, it is created automatically, with the suffix .log.

arguments.name: log
arguments.description:
If you omit the file argument, writes messages to standard log file. Ignored, if you specify file argument.
- application: writes to Application.log, normally used for application-specific messages.
- scheduler: writes to Scheduler.log, normally used to log the execution of scheduled tasks.

name: writelog
description: Writes a message to a log file.
